case_title: ABDUL QADEER and others vs STATE and others
reference_no_or_id: Crl. Appeal No. 112 of 2008 & Crl. R. No. 14 of 2008
complaint_summary: Nazir Ahmed reported the murder of his brother Abdul Razaq, whose body was found at Killi Ismail High School.
investigation_summary: Police investigation included site plan preparation, collection of evidence (blood-stained earth, bullets, etc.), and recording witness statements. Confessional statement of Abdul Qadeer was recorded under Section 164 Cr.P.C.
judgment_summary: The court altered the conviction from Section 303(a) PPC to Section 302(c) PPC, sentencing Abdul Qadeer to 7 years R.I. with benefit of Section 382-B Cr.P.C. The revision petition for enhancement of sentence was dismissed.
punishment: 7 years rigorous imprisonment under Section 302(c) PPC with benefit of Section 382-B Cr.P.C.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal disposed of; conviction altered to Section 302(c) PPC.
legal_arguments: Confessional statement was retracted but corroborated by circumstantial evidence.
Defense argued lack of independent corroboration for confessional statement.
Prosecution relied on confessional statement and circumstantial evidence.

witness_statement.Nazir Ahmed: Reported the murder of his brother Abdul Razaq.
witness_statement.Abdullah Jan: Found Abdul Razaq's body at the school.
witness_statement.Meera Jan: Received information about the murder of his son Abdul Razaq.
witness_statement.Muhammad Hayat: Discovered the body at the school.
witness_statement.Dr. Fareeda: Conducted post-mortem and confirmed bullet injuries.
witness_statement.Inayat Ullah: Recorded confessional statement of Abdul Qadeer.
witness_statement.Ali Ahmed: Confirmed Abdul Qadeer hired a CD film after the incident.
witness_statement.Tariq Manzoor: Investigating officer who collected evidence from the crime scene.

key_issues: Voluntariness and corroboration of confessional statement
Exceeding the right of self-defense under Section 100 PPC

maxims.Confession: Confession must be corroborated by independent evidence.

legal_terms.Ikrah-e-Tam: Fear of instant death or grievous harm leading to an act.

summary_vector_notes: Case involved murder allegedly committed under prolonged coercion and blackmail. Confession corroborated by circumstantial evidence led to conviction under Section 302(c) PPC.

arguments_by_appellant: Confessional statement was retracted and uncorroborated.
appeal_details.arguments_by_complainant: Requested enhancement of sentence under Section 302 P.P.C.

judgment_analysis.homicidal_death: Confirmed by Dr. Fareeda's medical evidence.
